job_title: Licensed Mental Health Therapist in Yakima, WA
cons: hectic schedule and very high caseloads

pros: The pay was competitive for the area. The work environment was comfortable enough, and the nature of the work was meaningful.
cons: The RN's back up in a mental health crisis, consisted of poorly supervised mental health workers. Their management was disengaged and unavailable, allowing for behaviors that were unacceptable in a work place and very disturbing to be around. Despite the obvious, and the multiple reports to management, the behaviors were allowed to continue, while these staff members fraternized and partied with the said management. Nursing management was also unavailable, disconnected and seemed uninterested in the reports of unprofessional conduct affecting the nursing staff. It was mysterious, as to how the nursing director acquired or kept their position, given the history of minimal nursing experience. The recruitment and retention of nurses was and continues to be disproportionate to the pay and benefits offered by the company.

pros: Great local support from teams and staff, good people.
cons: Management distrusted their leadership positions created unhealthy work environment

job_title: Certified Peer Counselor in Yakima, WA
pros: For me, working with the clients was the best part. It’s great to work with people who are trying hard to improve their lives. The company is very flexible if you need time off, or if you need to take a mental health day.
cons: It was often frustrating because I saw people’s needs go unmet for the simple reason of the company wanting to make sure their butts were covered in any situation, so they put their potential liability ahead of the client’s needs. All kinds of red tape just to try and help someone. I also didn’t feel like the company had my back. The company morale is pretty low. A little employee appreciation goes a long way, but there is way too little of that.

review_title: Poor compensation for exhausting, risky work in a skilled position.
pros: There are no pros so far.
cons: This company underpays employees. Because we don't get paid enough, we all have 2nd jobs or are looking for overtime hours. I'm in a position that requires a BA degree plus I have over 10 years of experience in jobs with transferable skills but I only get paid 25 cents more than employees with no degree who just graduated from high school. When I inquired about this they told me my salary aligns with others in the agency. What a load of crock. This company makes enough money to pay their employees fairly. You would think a mental health company would care about the mental health of their own employees but clearly that is not the case.

job_title: Behavioral Health Technician in Yakima, WA
pros: Fairly easy to take time off. Friendly coworkers and often friendly patients.
cons: Low pay. Low number of vacation days. Patients can sometimes be verbally or physically abusive.

job_title: Health Care Assistant in Beaver, PA
pros: The patients were the only positive.
cons: This was a very shady group of owners.

job_title: Mental Health Worker/Case Manager in Walla Walla, WA
pros:
Evening / night differential pay
Community work
cons:
Constantly hemorrhaging staff. Facilities are being expected to be full capacity with minimum legal staff which tbh is a safety issue.
Untrained staff. We're moving to more severe cases of clients without any real training on how to work with them. Only a high school diploma is required to take care of 16 indivduals that have a wide range of psychiatric symptoms.
If you feel uncomfortable or even unsafe, you're told to just deal with it.
Upper level doesn't listen to lower level concerns
Underpaid. The company has flat out admitted they don't have enough money to fully pay everyone the 1$ raise we got for COVID relief after our grant is used up. They're constantly focused on expanding rather than improving what they have.

job_title: Mental Health Worker in Yakima, WA
pros:
Benefits the community
Enjoyable work enviornment
cons:
Not much potential to move up
Giant disconnect between top and bottom of company

pros: Team Leader stipend, Atmosphere, direct supervision
cons: Pay, Communication with upper leadership, morale

pros: White Salmon is a nice town to work in. Small office. Beautiful area. Career opportunities are possible if you move to Yakima.
cons: Pay is low for the Gorge area. Expect to drive far to find safe and affordable housing.

pros: Great company to work for, good health benefits, great team work
cons: Can be a heavy work load at times.
High caseload, lots of bureaucracy, lots of upper management

job_title: Mental Health Worker in Yakima, WA
pros: Seems like a great place to start.
cons: Looks like they have some bad reviews about work ethic and work culture, but I'm not sure.

pros: The co-workers are pleasant. Food is available in the kitchen to make snacks and meals. Food prepared by cook is very good.
cons: Poor management does not tell the truth about hours. Under-staffed and lack of pay makes it difficult to keep a full staff.  Multiple training required but does not accommodate shift work.
Pay can be low to start
